title: A.I., rate cuts and Japan's rebound: Asia stocks are looking 'much more promising' than U.S. peers
description: Asia is more economically diverse than Europe and the U.S. and there are still bright spots in the region, especially in Japan and South Korea.

title: Microsoft CEO Nadella says he has 'no love' for exclusive deals between game companies and consoles
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said in court on Wednesday that he doesn't believe in making games exclusive to particular consoles.

title: Nvidia downplays possible U.S. chip export restrictions
description: Nvidia stock started recovering on Kress' comments before falling about 1.8% in intraday trading.

title: The tiny government agency behind a Chinese A.I. chip ban that's weighing on Nvidia
description: The Bureau of Industry and Security, was described in 2021 by Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo as a "small but mighty" agency at the heart of national security.

title: Nvidia's chips fuel A.I. — here's why the U.S. worries about China's access
description: Nvidia's powerful semiconductors have taken on particular importance as their capacity to fuel artificial intelligence has become increasingly sought after.

title: As drugmakers race to develop the next big weight loss pill, Eli Lilly may have an edge
description: For now, Eli Lilly's orforglipron appears to be the top contender in the weight loss pill space due to its strong efficacy data and ease of use.

title: Bank of England governor defies critics, says surprise rate hike was 'justified' to tame inflation
description: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said Wednesday that the bank was "justified" in its decision to raise interest rates by a surprise 50 basis points.

title: Just Stop Oil protesters halt second Ashes Test at Lord's | England's Jonny Bairstow carries one protester off
description: Two men from the Just Stop Oil campaign disrupted the second Ashes test match at Lords, releasing orange powder before being tackled by security staff.

title: Carl Pei's smartphone startup Nothing raises $96 million from investors for U.S. expansion
description: Nothing, the hardware startup from OnePlus co-founder Carl Pei, has raised $96 million from investors in a new round of funding.

title: Powell says more 'restriction' is coming, including possibility of hikes at consecutive meetings
description: Powell spoke at a European Central Bank monetary policy forum in Sintra, Portugal.

title: Watch Fed Chair Jerome Powell speak live at a policy forum in Portugal
description: Joining Powell are ECB President Christine Lagarde, Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey and Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda.

title: This new $250 Nokia smartphone can be self-repaired and comes with 5G
description: HMD Global, the Finnish company behind new Nokia smartphones, unveiled the Nokia G42 model on Wednesday.

title: Yevgeny Prigozhin's future — What could be next for Russia’s mutinous mercenary chief
description: Once a close ally and caterer to Russian President Vladimir Putin, Yevgeny Prigozhin now finds himself exiled in Belarus after leading an armed mutiny against the Russian military.

title: Samsung to begin making world's most advanced mobile chips in 2025 as battle with TSMC heats up
description: Samsung said it will begin mass production of the 2 nanometer process for mobile applications in 2025, in line with rival TSMC.

title: Belarus' Lukashenko says he convinced Putin not to eliminate Wagner leader Prigozhin
description: Yevghny Prigozhin's Russian paramilitary troops progressed towards Moscow over the weekend, before aborting their advance.

title: Chinese A.I. stocks fall as U.S. reportedly weighs curbs on chip exports
description: China's AI stocks fell Wednesday after The Wall Street Journal reported that the U.S. is planning to impose more chip restrictions

title: ECB chief economist warns markets against pricing in rate cuts within the next two years
description: European Central Bank Chief Economist Philip Lane on Tuesday warned markets against pricing in cuts to interest rates within the next two years.

title: Google is having productive talks with the EU on A.I. regulation, cloud boss says
description: Google has held "productive" talks with EU regulators about bringing in regulations for artificial intelligence, the company's head of cloud told CNBC.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Consumers might just prevent a U.S. recession
description: Fresh economic data from the U.S. showed a resilient economy that, with luck, might eventually defy predictions of recession.

title: India is heading for 'very high growth' but challenges remain, says Goldman Sachs CEO
description: India is on a high growth trajectory as more businesses continue to diversify their supply chains, but investing in the country comes with challenges.

title: Asia must reach net zero before the world can do so, says Petronas CEO
description: "The world cannot achieve net zero without Asia achieving net zero," says Petronas CEO Tengku Muhammad Taufik.

title: A.I. is not all hype. It's the 'fourth industrial revolution playing out,' says Wedbush's Dan Ives
description: Wedbush Securities' Dan Ives said Wednesday that the artificial intelligence boom is not all hype — but a "fourth industrial revolution playing out."

title: 1 in 5 employees are ‘loud quitting.’ Here’s why it’s worse than 'quiet quitting'
description: Loud quitters are employees who take actions that "directly harm" the organization, while undercutting its goals and opposing its leaders, said Gallup.
